Package comp3111.covid

Class ChartController

java.lang.Object
comp3111.covid.ChartController
Direct Known Subclasses:
ChartAController, ChartBController, ChartCController
public abstract class ChartController
extends java.lang.Object
An abstract controller class for chart. It handles the initialization of tab elements, and the drawing of the chart itself.

  • Method Details

    • getTableDataAnalysis

      public TableDataAnalysis getTableDataAnalysis()
      Returns tableDataAnalysis
      Returns:
      Returns tableDataAnalysis

    • initializeComponents

      protected abstract void initializeComponents​(Controller controller, TableDataAnalysis tableDataAnalysis)
      An abstract initializer that takes in only 1 controller and 1 tableDataAnalysis, this is created for derived classes to inherit from. In particular, within the body, the other initializer with many more arguments can be called. This offers the advantage that wherever this version of initializeComponents is called, only 2 arguments are needed, where the logic for initializing all other components (by calling the other version of initializeComponents) can be contained within the derived class.
      Parameters:
      controller - the main controller
      tableDataAnalysis - the table model

    • initializeComponents

      public void initializeComponents​(Controller controller, ChartView chartView, ChartDataAnalysis chartDataAnalysis, TableDataAnalysis tableDataAnalysis, javafx.scene.control.Label warningLabel, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker startDatePicker, javafx.scene.control.DatePicker endDatePicker, org.controlsfx.control.CheckComboBox<java.lang.String> dropDownMenu, javafx.scene.chart.LineChart<java.lang.Number,​java.lang.Double> lineChart, javafx.scene.control.Button naButton)
      Initializer for all components within a Chart Tab.
      Parameters:
      controller - the main controller
      chartView - the actual chart to be displayed
      chartDataAnalysis - the data model for chart
      tableDataAnalysis - the data model for table
      warningLabel - the warning label that warns when selected period is invalid
      startDatePicker - the start date picker
      endDatePicker - the end date picker
      dropDownMenu - the drop down menu from which countries can be chosen
      lineChart - a reference to linechart, which should be displayed
      naButton - the naButton, which appears when there is unavailbe data, shows details about unavailable data when clicked.

    • initializeStartDatePicker

      private void initializeStartDatePicker()
      This initializes the start date picker to one that has restricted range (DataAnalysis.startDateLimit ~ DataAnalysis.endDateLimit)

    • initializeEndDatePicker

      private void initializeEndDatePicker()
      This initializes the end date picker to one that has restricted range (DataAnalysis.startDateLimit ~ DataAnalysis.endDateLimit)

    • initializeCheckComboBox

      private void initializeCheckComboBox()
      This initializes the dropDownMenu, such that updateTable is invoked on every change of list of selected countries

    • initializeLineChart

      private void initializeLineChart()
      This initializes the line chart, such that the dateAxis can convert an input of unixTime into M/d/yyyy

    • validateDates

      private boolean validateDates()
      Returns true when startDate <= endDate. Returns false and show warning label when startDate > endDate.
      Returns:
      Returns true when startDate <= endDate, false otherwise.

    • updateChart

      protected void updateChart​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method updates the chart. It is invoked whenever new valid dates are picked or list of selected countries change.
      Parameters:
      e - the event

    • loadNATable

      protected void loadNATable​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e)
      This loads a table in another window which shows all the details about data supposed to be graphed but is unavailable from the dataset. Invoked when naButton is clicked.
      Parameters:
      e - the event
